2 ^ Salvum me fac: 3 ^ Infíxus sum in limo profùndi et non est substánția. Vêni in altitúdinem maris
Deus: et tempèstas demèrsit me. ^ I stick fast in the mire of the deep and there is no sure standing. I am come into the depth of the sea
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and a tempest hath overwhelmed me.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 4 ^ Laborávi clamans~; raŭcaĕ factaĕ sunt faŭces meaĕ~; defecérunt òculi mei
Deus: dum spero in Deum meum. ^ I have laboured with crying~; my jaws are become hoarse~; my eyes have failed
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: whilst I hope in my God.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 5 ^ Multiplicáti sunt super capìllos cápitis mei qŭi odérunt me gratîs. confortáti sunt qŭi persecúti sunt me inimíci mei injúste~; qŭaĕ non rápui
Deus: tunc exsolvébam. ^ They are multiplied above the hairs of my head who hate me without cause. My enemies are grown strong who have wrongfully persecuted me~; then did I pay that which I took not away.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 6 ^ Deus
Deus: tu scis insapientiam meam
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et delìcta mea a te non sunt abscòndita. ^ O God
for the waters are come in even unto my: and my offences are not hidden from thee.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 7 ^ Non erubéscant in me qŭi expèctant te
Deus: Dòmine
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: Dòmine virtútum. Non confundántur super me qŭi qŭaĕrunt te
O God: Deus Israhélis. ^ Let not them be ashamed who look for thee because of me
column6: the Lord of hosts. Let them not be confounded on my account

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 8 ^ Qŭóniam pròpter te sustìnui oppróbrium~; opèruit confúsio fáciem meam. ^ Because for thy sake I have borne reproach~; shame hath covered my face.
9 ^ Extráneus factus sum frátribus meîs
Deus: et peregrínus fíliîs matris meaĕ. ^ I am become a stranger to my brethren
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and an alien to the sons of my mother.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 10 ^ Qŭóniam șelus domûs tuaĕ comédit me
Deus: et oppróbria exprobrántium tìbi cecidérunt super me. ^ For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 11 ^ Et opèrui in jejúnio ánimam meam
Deus: et factum est in oppróbrium mìhi. ^ And I covered my soul in fasting
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and it was made a reproach to me.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 12 ^ Et pósui vestimèntum meum cilìcium
Deus: et factus sum illîs in parábolam. ^ And I made haircloth my garment
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and I became a byword to them.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 13 ^ Advèrsum me loqŭebántur qŭi sědébant in porta
Deus: et in me psallébant qŭi bibébant vínum. ^ They that sat in the gate spoke against me
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and they that drank wine made me their song.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 14 ^ Ego vero orațiónem meam ad te Dòmine~; tempus beneplácití
Deus: Deus. In multitúdine misericórdiaĕ tuaĕ
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: exáŭdi me in veritáte salútis tuaĕ. ^ But as for me
for the waters are come in even unto my: O Lord~; for the time of thy good pleasure
column6: O God. In the multitude of thy mercy hear me
column7: in the truth of thy salvation.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 15 ^ Éripe me de luto
Deus: ut non infíǧar~; líbera me ab eîs qŭi odérunt me
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et de profùndîs aqŭárum. ^ Draw me out of the mire
O God: that I may not stick fast~; deliver me from them that hate me
for the waters are come in even unto my: and out of the deep waters.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 16 ^ Non me demèrǧat tempèstas aqŭaĕ
Deus: nèqŭe absórbeat me profùndum
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: nèqŭe ùrǧeat super me púteus os suum. ^ Let not the tempest of water drown me
O God: nor the deep water swallow me up
for the waters are come in even unto my: and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 17 ^ Exáŭdi me
Deus: Dòmine
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: qŭóniam benìgna est misericórdia tua~; secùndum multitúdinem miserațiónum tuárum rèspice in me. ^ Hear me
for the waters are come in even unto my: for thy mercy is kind~; look upon me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 18 ^ Et ne avèrtas fáciem tuam a púero tuo~; qŭóniam trìbulor
Deus: velóciter exáŭdi me. ^ And turn not away thy face from thy servant~; for I am in trouble
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: hear me speedily.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 19 ^ Intènde ánimaĕ meaĕ
Deus: et líbera eam~; pròpter inimícos meos éripe me. ^ Attend to my soul
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and deliver it~; save me because of my enemies.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 20 ^ Tu scis impropèrium meum
Deus: et confusiónem meam
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et reverènțiam meam~; in conspèctu tuo sunt òmnes qŭi trìbulant me. ^ Thou knowest my reproach
for the waters are come in even unto my: and my shame~; in thy sight are all they that afflict me.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 21 ^ Impropèrium expectávit cor meum et misèriam
Deus: et sustìnui qŭi sìmul contristarétur
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et non fuit
for the waters are come in even unto my: et non invéni. ^ My heart hath expected reproach and misery
column6: and I looked for one that would grieve together with me
column8: and for one that would comfort me

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 22 ^ Et dedérunt in escam meam fel
Deus: et in sìti mea potavérunt me acéto. ^ And they gave me gall for my food
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 23 ^ Fiat mensa eórum coram ìpsîs in láqŭeum
Deus: et in retribûțiónes
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et in scándalum. ^ Let their table become as a snare before them

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 24 ^ Obscurèntur òculi eórum
Deus: ne vìdeant
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et dorsum eórum sèmper incùrva. ^ Let their eyes be darkened
for the waters are come in even unto my: and their back bend thou down always.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 25 ^ Effùnde super eos iram tuam
Deus: et furor iraĕ tuaĕ comprehèndat eos. ^ Pour out thy indignation upon them
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and let the wrath of thy anger take hold of them.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 26 ^ Fiat habitáțio eórum desèrta
Deus: et in tabernáculîs eórum non sit qŭi inhábitet. ^ Let their habitation be made desolate
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and let there be none to dwell in their tabernacles.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 27 ^ Qŭóniam qŭem tu percussìsti persecúti sunt
Deus: et super dolórem vùlnerum meórum addidérunt. ^ Because they have persecuted him whom thou hast smitten
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and they have added to the grief of my wounds.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 28 ^ Appóne iniqŭitátem super iniqŭitátem eórum
Deus: et non intrent in justìțiam tuam. ^ Add thou iniquity upon their iniquity
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and let them not come into thy justice.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 29 ^ Deleántur de lìbro vivèntium
Deus: et cum justîs non scribántur. ^ Let them be blotted out of the book of the living
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and with the just let them not be written.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 30 ^ Ego sum paŭper et dolens~; salûs tua
Deus: Deus
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: suscépit me. ^ But I am poor and sorrowful~; thy salvation

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 31 ^ Laŭdábo nomen Dei cum cántico
Deus: et magnificábo eum in laŭde~; ^ I will praise the name of God with a canticle
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and I will magnify him with praise~;

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 32 ^ Et placébit Deo super vìtulum novèllum
Deus: córnua producèntem et ùngulas. ^ and it shall please God better than a young calf
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: that bringeth forth horns and hoofs.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 33 ^ Vìdeant páŭperes et laĕtèntur~; qŭaĕrite Deum
Deus: et vivet ánima vèstra. ^ Let the poor see and rejoice~; seek ye God
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and your soul shall live.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 34 ^ Qŭóniam exaŭdívit páŭperes Dòminus
Deus: et vinctos suos non despèxit. ^ For the Lord hath heard the poor
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and hath not despised his prisoners.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 35 ^ Laŭdent illum caĕli et terra~; mare
Deus: et òmnia reptìlia in eîs. ^ Let the heavens and the earth praise him~; the sea
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and every thing that creepeth therein.

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 36 ^ Qŭóniam Deus salvam fáciet Siónem
Deus: et aĕdificabùntur civitátes Judaĕ. Et inhabitábunt ìbi
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: et hereditáte acqŭírent eam. ^ For God will save Sion
O God: and the cities of Judah shall be built up. And they shall dwell there

2 ^ Salvum me fac: 37 ^ Et semen servórum ejus possidébit eam~; et qŭi díliǧunt nomen ejus
Deus: habitábunt in ea. ^ And the seed of his servants shall possess it
qŭóniam intravérunt aqŭaĕ usqŭe ad ánim: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
